front.title: RTP Control Protocol (RTCP) Extended Report (XR) Block for MPEG Transport Stream Decodability Statistics Metric reporting

author.organization: National Institute of Information and Communications Technology

abstract.t: An MPEG Transport Stream (TS) is a standard container format used in the transmission and storage of multimedia data. Unicast/Multicast/ Broadcast MPEG-TS over RTP is widely deployed in IPTV systems. This document defines an RTP Control Protocol (RTCP) Extended Report (XR) Block that allows the reporting of MPEG Transport Stream decodability statistics metrics related to transmissions of MPEG-TS over RTP.

section.title: MPEG Transport Stream Decodability Metrics
section.t:
The European Telecommunications Standards Institute (ETSI) has defined a set of syntax and information consistency tests and corresponding indicators that are recommended for the monitoring of MPEG-2 Transport Streams . The tests and corresponding indicators are grouped according to priority: First priority - Necessary for de-codability (basic monitoring)
Second priority - Recommended for continuous or periodic monitoring
Third priority - Recommended for application-dependant monitoring

This memo is based on information consistency tests and resulting indicators defined by ETSI and defines a new block type to augment those defined in Freidman, et al. for use with Transport Stream (TS) . The new block type supports reporting of the number of occurrences of each indicator in the first and second priorities; third priority indicators are not supported.

section.title: RTCP and RTCP XR Reports
section.t: The use of RTCP for reporting is defined in . defined an extensible structure for reporting using an RTCP Extended Report (XR). This document defines a new Extended Report block for use with and .

section.title: Performance Metrics Framework
section.t: The Performance Metrics Framework [RFC6390] provides guidance on the definition and specification of performance metrics. The RTP Monitoring Architectures provides guideline for reporting block format using RTCP XR. The new report block described in this memo is in compliance with the monitoring architecture specified in and the Performance Metrics Framework .

section.title: Applicability
section.t: These metrics are applicable to any type of RTP application that uses the MPEG-TS standard format for multimedia data; for example, MPEG4 TS content over RTP. This new block type can be useful for measuring content stream or TS quality by checking TS header information and identifying the existence, and characterizing the severity, of bitstream packetization problems which may affect users' perception of a service delivered over RTP; it may also be useful for verifying the continued correct operation of an existing system management tool.

section.title: Standards Language
section.t: The key words "MUST", "MUST NOT", "REQUIRED", "SHALL", "SHALL NOT", "SHOULD", "SHOULD NOT", "RECOMMENDED", "MAY", and "OPTIONAL" in this document are to be interpreted as described in RFC 2119.

section.title: MPEG Transport Stream Decodability Statistics Metric Report Block
section.t:
This block reports MPEG transport stream decodability statistics metrics beyond the information carried in the standard RTCP packet format, which are measured at the receiving end of the RTP stream. It defines eight metrics based on ETSI TR 101 290. Information is reported about basic monitoring parameters necessary to ensure that the TS can be decoded including: Transport Stream Synchronization Losses
Sync byte errors
Continuity count errors and continuous monitoring parameters including: Transport errors
Program Clock Reference (PCR) errors
PCR repetition errors
PCR discontinuity indicator errors
Presentation Time Stamp (PTS) errors The other parameters are ignored since they do not apply to all MPEG implementations. For further information on these parameters, see . The MPEG-TS Decodability Metrics Block has the following format:

section.title: SDP Signaling
section.t: RFC 3611 defines the use of SDP (Session Description Protocol) for signaling the use of RTCP XR blocks. XR blocks MAY be used without prior signaling.

section.title: SDP rtcp-xr-attrib Atrribute Extension
section.t:
This session augments the SDP attribute "rtcp-xr" defined in Section 5.1 of RFC 3611 by providing an additional value of "xr-format" to signal the use of the report block defined in this document.
xr-format =/ ts-decodability-metrics
ts-decodability-metrics = "ts-decodability-metrics"

section.title: Offer/Answer Usage
section.t: When SDP is used in offer-answer context, the SDP Offer/Answer usage defined in for unilateral "rtcp-xr" attribute parameters applies. For detailed usage in Offer/Answer for unilateral parameter, refer to section 5.2 of .

section.title: IANA Considerations
section.t:
New report block types for RTCP XR are subject to IANA registration. For general guidelines on IANA allocations for RTCP XR, refer to Section 6.2 ofRFC 3611. This document assigns one new block type value in the RTCP XR Block Type Registry:
TSDM
TR 101 290 MPEG Transport Stream Decodability Metrics
<TSDM>
Section 3
This document also registers one SDP parameters for the "rtcp-xr" attribute in the RTCP XR SDP Parameter Registry:
“ts-decodability-metrics”

section.title: Security Considerations
section.t: This proposed RTCP XR report block introduces no new security considerations beyond those described in RFC 3611.
